channel.description: Recent content in itsbuiltin on Math2001's blog

item.title: Vim Line Completion
item.description: Do you know what kind of completion this is? Line completion. It looks for every lines that starts with the same text (it doesn’t take into consideration the indication), and completes it for you! Awesome right? And to do that, you just need to press this while you’re in insert mode: ctrl+x and ctrl+l

item.title: Bash's find command
item.description:
The find command in bash is quite powerful, and knowing the basics might save you some scripting.

What does it do? It “finds” files. By default, it outputs their path relative to where you ran find. But, in addition of providing you with advanced “filters” it actually allows you to run commands on each of those files.

Let’s get started!

item.title: The string module in Python
item.description: If you want the list of every letter, just do: >>> import string >>> print(string.ascii_uppercase) ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
